relevant_findings.abdomen: Tenderness in left lower quadrant (LLQ), non-distended, normal bowel sounds.
relevant_findings.lungs: Coughing, transmitted upper airway sounds, difficulty clearing secretions.
relevant_findings.skin: Dark pigmented patches in bilateral axillas with excoriations.
relevant_findings.neurologic: Difficult to assess due to minimal verbal ability.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient was initially noted to have significant abdominal tenderness and poor oral intake. There was an improvement in tenderness upon re-evaluation.

relevant_findings.general: Ill appearing male, minimally verbal, able to follow simple commands.
relevant_findings.abdomen: Non-tender to palpation, normal bowel sounds, non-distended.
relevant_findings.lungs: Non-labored respirations, loud upper airway sounds with no crackles or wheezes.
relevant_findings.extremities: Contractures in right upper and lower extremities are noted.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient's abdominal tenderness decreased from initially noted tenderness in LLQ to non-tender status. Neurological assessment improved as patient was able to follow commands.
